reviewText:
The full horror of this daft movie dawns early, as the credits roll and we are in a nightclub. We are hearing Cool Jazz, completely at odds with the Sitar and Tabla Indian band shown playing.

The victim, delightfully naked throughout the movie, is chained in the most unlikely manner in a pose that would be painful for any length of time, yet she smiles and gets horny after her shots from the nasty doctor. The other sister is also naked a lot, as are the doctor and the maid/nurse, various male prostitutes and for all I know the family cat. Lots of simulated sex, some with a narrated backstory event that made my skin crawl. Then, in a very abrupt and unlikely about face, the hero rescues the (naked) heroine and the bad guys just give up.

I'll three star the ladies sans culottes (or anything else for that matter) but the plot is stupid, the dubbing trite and horrible in places and the bondage unconvincing. Whatever you are looking for in this movie there are better examples available on the web.

Picture quality seems very good.

Two women spend most of the film naked. Multiple full frontals and topless. One woman gives a topless only. One other woman gives a couple topless and a full frontal. Beautiful real breasts and hair around the vaginal area
One of the lesser Franco flicks, but still with lots of T&A.

This is a movie revealing one's evil for money.  A wealthy father leaves his fortune to two daughters, 50/50 after his death.  Sister A the Evil has long planned to own everything, 100%. She has worked with a corrupted doctor to drug her Sister B starving for sex. They put Sister B in a locked room labeling for sickness.  As needed, Sister A uses herself as a prey.  She then brings home the swinger to satisfy her Sister B.  To all credits, this
family plot works smoothly.  Sister B is known as a patient unfit to manage money and daily events.  Meaning Sister A is to inherit and control all,
100%.  Who and What is the leakage of this evil plan?  Watch this movie.
Yes, there are a few nude scenes, all soft core.
Good story line kept me interested, had a good ending.
